Description: Select all columns from the table identified by 'syn123'.
Select only two columns identified by 'foo' and 'bar' from the table identified by 'syn'123'.
To refer to a column name that contains spaces or punctuation, the name must be with double quotes.
Any double quotes within a column name must be escaped with another double quote.
Count the number of rows in table 'syn123'.
Get the maximum of all values for the column 'foo' in table 'syn123'.
Get the minimum of all values for the column 'foo' in table 'syn123'.
Get the average of all values for the column 'foo' in table 'syn123'.
Get the sum of all values for the column 'foo' in table 'syn123'.
The DISTINCT keyword can be used to select all distinct value (the value set) from a column.
The DISTINCT keyword applies to all selected columns, so if more than one column is listed, then the results will be a list of the distict combinations of all selected columns.
SQL: select distinct foo, bar from syn123

Description: The DISTINCT keyword can be used with set functions.  In this example, we will get the count of the distinct values from the foo column.
